translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Group of Ones with Less Than Ten Thousand
The Elder Nun Naḷamālikā’s Verses
On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was a Kinnarī then.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the self-dependent, the unconquered.
With a mind full of confidence,
with a mind full of joy,
having taken a garland of reeds,
I worshipped the self-dependent one.
By that deed well done,
by the intention and the aspiration,
having given up the body of a Kinnarī,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
Among the thirty-six gods’ kings, 🔽I was the one with the greatest merit.
Whatever I wished for in my mind,
it appeared just as I desired.
Among the ten Wheel-turning Monarchs,
I was the one with the greatest merit.
Having become skilled, 🔽I transmigrate through existences. 🔽I have wholesome (deeds)
I went forth into homelessness.
Today I am worthy of offerings,
in the doctrine of the Buddha’s son.
Today my mind is purified,
free of evil, free of hate.
All the pollutants are destroyed,
there is no continuation in existence.
For ninety-four aeons
I worshipped the Buddha;
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the result of the garland of reeds.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ naḷamālikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam naḷamālikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the nun Naḷamālikā recited these verses.
The Story of Nun Naḷamālikā is the sixth.
